posts.name: Steve Seguin
posts.cooked:
The text is: EXTREMLY IMPORTANTLY - DO NOT OUTPUT ANYTHING BUT THE CLEANED VERSION (NO INTRODUCTION, NO OTHER LITTLE EXPLENATION), JUST THE CLEANED PARAGRAPH. The text is:

Hi all, just recently got photonvision up and running on a jetson orin nano developer kit, and have a fisheye drive (arducam IMX291) and an Innomaker OV9281 for April tags. The driver can works flawlessly, and the OV9281 works fine until I go to perform calibration, then I instantly get the “camera lost” graphic.

If I cancel the calibration and restart it, the image briefly appears before disappearing again. I can only get the image back by unplugging the USB and plugging it in again.

In the photonvision logs, I get a couple errors, and one warning. Not sure if it’s the camera, or if I’m doing something wrong?

175037845156686879316489118431051920×2560 723 KB

posts.name: Steve Seguin
posts.cooked: Had anyone had this type of issue with the Inno maker OV9281? Looks like the stream is lost when Auto Exposure is enabled. *Edited title and posts to clarify the actual manufacturer's name as innomaker rather than innovision.*

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: This seems to be fairly common with this camera. This might serve as a solution for your issue, it would be great if you could leave a note with your hardware setup and whether the solution worked as well.

link_counts.title: Auto-exposure during camera calibration (or at any time, but it is forced on during calibration) causes camera to disconnect · Issue #1752 · PhotonVision/photonvision · GitHub

posts.name: Steve Seguin
posts.cooked: This workaround was successful for me as well. NVidia Jetson Orin Nano Super Development Kit with Jetpack 6.2 installed on a 128GB SD card. innomaker OV9281 Arducam IMX291 wide-angle camera also connected

posts.name: Jeffrey Morris
posts.cooked: I'm glad my stubborness to make it work has been useful for others

posts.name: Steve Seguin
posts.cooked: I do have another question though based on my novice experience with Linux Following all of the instructions results in the cloning of the git repository to the jetson however now I want it to start on boot up naturally or we won’t be able to use it in competition All the instructions to do so reference the jar file which I haven’t downloaded Do I have to download the jar run it and set everything up again or is there another way for the jetson

posts.name: Jeffrey Morris
posts.cooked: definitely not my area of expertise here… But when you build photonvision locally, how are you starting it? My understanding is you build the jar with gradle and run it. Just curious what you’re doing differently, I’m pretty confident that’s the jar in question.

posts.name: Steve Seguin
posts.cooked: I use the terminal on the Jetson, go to the PhotonVision folder and execute the ./Gradle run command. Just not sure how to get that to run as a service so it can be headless.

posts.name: Jeffrey Morris
posts.cooked:
./gradle shadowJar will generate the jar.

To build PhotonVision documentation visit https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/contributing/building-photon.html#build-and-run-photonvision.

This section contains build instructions from our GitHub page. Development Setup: Prerequisites: Java Development Kit: This project requires Java Development Kit (JDK) installed. Once JDK is installed you can build the project by executing mvn compile followed by mvn exec:java.

After compiling the source code execute the generated JAR file via java -jar app.jar.

posts.name: Steve Seguin
posts.cooked: Thanks! I remembered seeing the shadowjar command somewhere, but couldn’t find it again for the life of me; I kept skipping over it… repeatedly. I should be able to create the service and get it up and running now.

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: If you need further assistance, I'd examine the install script located in the main repo along with the other scripts it references. This should provide a general idea of our setup process for creating an environment utilizing Photon Vision, an open-source vision library for coprocessors.
